comment: Took him for A&P1 lecture. He's a great professor and anyone who gave him under a 3 did something wrong on their part. He has lots of extra credit and you have multiple tries on homework. Try to ace the first 2-3 exams and you can have room for error on the remaining. Gracious with exams too. He's nice and if he taught A&P 2 I would take him.

I love prof schenider! He talked about his personal life a lot, but he tied it back into the lectures, and he used those stories to simultaneously teach us about the content. Show up to class, do your homework and you'll do fine.

He's a good person, but his class was not great. he goes through the slides really fast and you don't really have a moment to listen to him while trying to take notes. definitely have to teach yourself a bit before and after lecture to be prepared. his exams are also pretty tough. the final dropped my grade like 2 points making me lose my B.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: yall know that burn book from mean girls when regina wrote about katie, yeah thats all i have to say

This professor was amazing in my opinion, don't let the bad reviews scare you off. As long as you read and learn his provided lecture notes you'll be fine. His tests are pretty similar to his notes and he always curves about 5 points and then gives 8 points of extra credit just for the heck of it. I recommend taking him for lab as well.

I loved Professor Schneider. He comes up with ways to remember the material and tells you the important stuff to remember. The course is hard because of how much material is covered but it is not impossible. You will have to put in work outside of class and attend the lectures if you want a good grade. He only changes things to help the class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Be consistent in this class when it comes to studying. Andrew is amazing at helping you remember anatomy and gives great mnemonics, tricks and stories to help you truly learn and remember and not just read off slides. Was a perfect way to start my anatomy journey. Responds to emails fast and very personable. Definitely take him!!

This class is very hard and I don't think this Professor made it any easier. You have to teach a lot of the course yourself because he can't go over all the content to the ability of understanding. He does random attendance quizzes that you can only get into with the random code he shows in person, so RIP if your sick that day. ALSO is very sassy.

Prof. Schneider was great, his lectures were interesting and made the material easy to understand. You can do bad on the exams and still pass the class. gives random participation quizzes, but he tells you the answers. drops a couple of grades in each category. if you're not lazy you will pass his class

For a A&P he's a good teacher, a little sassy tho. His test were word for word from the presenter notes on his ppts. Small details on it would be questions on the test. He typically curves the tests 5-7 points depending on the class & gives another free 8 points. Def don't take him if you want an easy A, it does take effort and a bit of studying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: I would recommend him if you are fresh to anatomy as he keeps lecture interesting. Although attendance is not recorded I would definitely not recommend skipping class as he covers so much content in one lecture so try and be there. But he gives a lot of lean way when it comes to exams which will help your grade in the end

This is a hard class and you do have to teach yourself a lot. For each test, I studied an average of 15 hours and it helped prepare me for nursing school. He makes it impossible to fail the class, you can fail every test and still end with a B. There is an extra credit assignment after every test and he curves all of the exams by a lot.
Hard class i took his A&P he only cares about his students in the front of the class, also test are 90% of your grade. Don't recommend at all.
Just keep looking.

Great professor overall, caring & wants you to do good. Gives lots of extra credit & curves for tests, as they are very difficult. Slides are just pictures, but the presenter notes will help. Would recommend taking professor Schneider, but beware the class is very difficult and you have to spend a lot of time studying outside of class.

Schneider is a great professor who wants the best for students. I loved his lectures because he was great at explaining concepts and terms while also making jokes and telling stories. Everyone who took this class and has a problem with Schneider is just plain lazy. Your work will truly reflect your grade... so put time into this class.

Schneider genuinely wants you to do good. He can give you the information but you have to put in the work to pass. There is no way you will get through a class like A&P without studying.  He offers 100 points worth of participation for in class assignments which is basically a letter grade.

Show up to class, it's apart of your grade. Although this is not an easy course if you put in the effort and use the materials given and apply yourself it is possible to do good. I honestly feel like he over prepares you for the exams, I always went in unsure how I would do and got an A on every exam. Definitely recommend Prof Schneider!

He is actually very nice but you do have to teach yourself everything. You can fail every exam and still pass this class with a B if you do every other assignment. Just study. He does give bonus points on tests so that can boost your grade up.

He is not a bad professor.If there are other teachers take them instead tho b/c you will have to put in the work and study outside of class A LOT he is very generous and has in class quizzes,powerpoints are just pic, lecture notes are confusing, does do quizzes for some ch, class is not so hard if you put in the work I passed with an A just study
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He was a funny professor. His power points were all pictures, so you have to know how to make your own notes from the textbook. His quizzes and tests aren't too hard. The quizzes and homework were due before the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He is not a bad teacher. His lectures aren't great, but I think he expects you to have preread the information. I like how his tests are set up. you definitely will have to teach yourself this class, but he gives you every rescource to do so. Every good student already knows that you have to review the info outside of class if you want it to stick
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: professor schneider goes into depth in learning material- if you pay attention and take his advice, lab will go well. he teaches a & p lecture as well and I recommend him as well for lecture.

I actually take him for Anatomy Lecture and he doesn't teach the information at all. He reads off of slides that only contain images and he doesn't differentiate between topics. He just reads off of the slides with no learning objectives and has tests with information he only skimmed over or briefly talked about. He doesn't care that people fail.

He was an amazing professor. Had deadlines clearly posted at the beginning of each week and is very approachable. Took him during an 8 week summer class and he was very accomodating. His powerpoints don't have words on them but I would recommend using them as a guideline on what to focus on when taking notes in the textbook before class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I was scared going into this class, but it wasnt bad. He cut class short, class was out by 1, but we were done by 12. All he did was point out and say what the structure was, there are no outside assignments except pre & post-lab quizzes. Miss 3 classes you are dropped. 3 Lab Exams worth 150 points. No dropped assignments. Extra credit at the end.

I had TA reed and he made the class easier in my opinion. The main professor is not good at responding to emails and didn't really care about giving the TA instructions so they kinda guessed. Overall ig you get a TA make sure they are good before you take the class. Alyssa and reed are the best.

I attended every single class and did not meet professor Schneider once. He had a student teacher teach all the lessons, give us class assignments, and administer tests. Tests are difficult to prepare for and take. Luckily he curved them so I made an A.

I was nervous taking his class.. He is not the best but he offers a ton of extra credit for attentance.. offers fill in the blank study guides for tests .. and extra credit after every test. MAKE SURE TO ACTUALLY READ AND TAKE NOTES FROM THE TEXTBOOK.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Don't let the poor reviews fool you. I was scared going into this class due to how bad people talked about him. However, he has not once shown up to class. It is run by a TA that is incredibly nice and knowledgable about the content.

Don't listen to the other reviews. he offers a ton of extra credit. A&P is a hard class in general but he tends to teach through lectures slides (with just pictures).. so make sure to read the textbook

Professor Schneider is a very nice guy, he is extremely understanding when his students have to miss something and he helps you find a time to make it up. But, he isn't the best lecturer. You really don't learn anything in class, it's all self taught. His exams are really hard and they count for almost all of your grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Make sure you show up to class it helps alot with your grade because he gives easy extra points to do learning catalytics.

He was an okay professor and cares but the class overall is alot, his lectures are not much helpful they are just pictures and he talks the whole class period so you have to be prepared to self teach and read the book. The test are hard but if you get atleast and 65 on each and get an A on homework and quizzes you can leave with an C.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Schneider is an ok lab instructor, but his labs are monotonous. A & P lab can be a rigorous course so just imagine it being boring too. You'll complete pre-lab and post-labs on Mastering which can be easy most days. His tests are okay, just make sure to ask what to study and study everything he may have mentioned or shown during lab.
